section.title: Sound Settings
section.para: Most of the settings in this section are self-explanatory. Ones of special interested are listed below.

row.entry: If disabled, JGlideMon will not play any sounds.
If enabled, an alert will sound when your character dies or Glider stops.
If disabled, JGlideMon will not synthesize speech.
If enabled, JGlideMon will announce "Connected to/Disconnected from server" as appropriate.

section.title: Custom Sounds
section.para:
It is possible to replace the default sounds that are bundled with JGlideMon, if desired. To do so, create a folder named "sounds" as a sub-folder in the folder where JGlideMon.jar is located (if it does not already exist). Copy a wav file into this folder and rename it appropriately for the sound you wish to replace. The file names you can replace are:
Whisper.wav GMWhisper.wav PlayerAttack.wav PlayerNear.wav GlideStop.wav

If you add or change the sounds while JGlideMon is running, you can reload them by clicking the "Reload Custom Sounds" button. Otherwise, the changes will take effect the next time JGlideMon is restarted.
